## Linear Model

The linear model can be expressed as:

$$
y \sim \mathcal{N}(\underbrace{a + bx}_{\text{model}},{\sigma})
$$

Alternatively, we can write this more explicitly as:

$$
y \sim \underbrace{\mathcal{N}(\cdot, \sigma)}_{\text{likelihood}} \quad \text{where} \quad \underbrace{a + bx}_{\text{model}}
$$

Or in a more standard form:

$$
y_i \sim \mathcal{N}(\mu_i, \sigma) \quad Likeihood
$$
$$
\mu_i = a + bx_i  \quad Model
$$
$$
\mathcal{N}(\mu_i, \sigma)  \quad Marginal
$$
